         <article id="post-804" class="post-804 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-javascript-tutorial category-nodejs-tutorial tag-node-js tag-node-js-mysql tag-node-js-rest-api tag-node-js-tutorial tag-node-js-express">
          <div class="post-inner-content">
           <header class="entry-header page-header">
            <h1 class="entry-title ">Node js User Authentication using MySQL and Express JS</h1>
            <div class="entry-meta"> 
             <span class="posted-on"><i class="fa fa-calendar"></i> <a href="https://www.js-tutorials.com/javascript-tutorial/node-js-user-authentication-using-mysql-express-js/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date published" datetime="2017-02-28T11:21:17+00:00">February 28, 2017</time><time class="updated" datetime="2017-08-21T06:17:47+00:00">August 21, 2017</time></a></span>
             <span class="byline"> <i class="fa fa-user"></i> <span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://www.js-tutorials.com/author/admin/">Adam</a></span></span> 
             <span class="cat-links"><i class="fa fa-folder-open-o"></i> <a href="https://www.js-tutorials.com/category/javascript-tutorial/" rel="category tag">javascript</a>, <a href="https://www.js-tutorials.com/category/javascript-tutorial/nodejs-tutorial/" rel="category tag">Nodejs Tutorials</a> </span>
            </div>
            <!-- .entry-meta -->
           </header>
           <!-- .entry-header -->
           <div class="entry-content">
            <div class="at-above-post addthis_tool" data-url="https://www.js-tutorials.com/javascript-tutorial/node-js-user-authentication-using-mysql-express-js/"></div>
            <div class="insert-post-ads3"> 
             <script async src="//pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js"></script> 
             <!-- responsive-336 --> 
             <ins class="adsbygoogle" style="display:block" data-ad-client="ca-pub-1657751670778791" data-ad-slot="5334669865" data-ad-format="auto"></ins> 
             <script>(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});</script> 
            </div>
            <p>Node js is providing an event-driven I/O model that makes node js application lightweight and efficient.This node js tutorial help to create user authentication system using MySQL and express js. I am creating a simple web application using nodejs, mysql, express and ejs. I am using ejs aka Embedded JavaScript module for template engine in node js example.<br> <span id="more-804"></span></p>
            <p>I have already covered <a href="https://www.js-tutorials.com/javascript-tutorial/nodejs-tutorial/getting-started-with-nodejs-application/" target="_blank" class="link-red">Simple Hello Nodejs tutorial</a>, <a href="https://www.js-tutorials.com/javascript-tutorial/nodejs-tutorial-add-edit-delete-record-using-mysql/" target="_blank" class="link-red">Add, Edit and Delete Record using MySQL and nodejs</a> and <a href="https://www.js-tutorials.com/javascript-tutorial/node-js-rest-api-add-edit-delete-record-mysql-using-express/" target="_blank" class="link-red">Simple Rest API example using nodejs and MySQL</a>. I am not covering some basics of node js like how to create nodejs?, what is <code>package.json</code>?, How to to install <em>npm</em>. I am assuming you guys aware about these things, now lets go new things of nodejs.</p>
            <p>We will cover following functionality into this node js tutorial:</p>
            <ul>
             <li>How to create database and table into MySQL server</li>
             <li>How to add routing with node js application</li>
             <li>How to handle session in node js application</li>
             <li>ejs template engine integration with node js application</li>
             <li>How to use partial file in node js application</li>
             <li>Notification/Message integration in node js application</li>
            </ul>
            <h2>Simple Example of Node js Authentication with MySQL</h2>
            <p><img src="https://www.js-tutorials.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/profile.png" alt="profile" width="651" height="334" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-807" srcset="https://www.js-tutorials.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/profile.png 651w, https://www.js-tutorials.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/profile-300x154.png 300w" sizes="(max-width: 651px) 100vw, 651px"></p>
            <p>We will authenticate user using MySQL database.We will create GET and POST type HTTP request to show login and post login information to server.I am using Bootstrap CSS to create beautiful login and registration form.</p>
            <div class="YiuMA1OM" style="clear:both;float:left;width:100%;margin:0 0 20px 0;">
             <script async src="//pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js"></script> 
             <ins class="adsbygoogle" style="display:block; text-align:center;" data-ad-format="fluid" data-ad-layout="in-article" data-ad-client="ca-pub-1657751670778791" data-ad-slot="9195044667"></ins> 
             <script>(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});</script>
            </div>
            <h4>I am using following files and folder</h4>
            <p>I am creating a folder <strong>nodejs_auth_example</strong>.This is our node js project name.</p>
            <p><strong>views folder:</strong> This folder will contain all ejs template files.<br> <strong>public folder:</strong> This folder will contain all external css and js files.<br> <strong>routes folder:</strong> This folder will contain all controller file.<br> <strong>app.php:</strong> This file will use to create nodejs application server and routes url.<br> <strong>node_modules folder:</strong> This folder will contain all node.js packages.</p>
            <h3>Create Database and Table Structure for User Authentication</h3>
            <p>I am using mysql server for user authentication.You need to create <code>'test'</code> name database into mysql server.You can create database using GUI or from command line whatever you like, Lets create <code>'users'</code> table into <code>'test'</code> MySQL database using below script.</p>
            <p></p>
            <!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->
            <div id="crayon-59bec9dc49fc8430074349" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
             <div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;">
              <span class="crayon-title"></span>
              <div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;">
               <div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers">

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS `users` (
  `id` int(5) NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,
  `first_name` text NOT NULL,
  `last_name` text NOT NULL,
  `mob_no` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `user_name` varchar(20) NOT NULL,
  `password` varchar(15) NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY (`id`)
) ENGINE=InnoDB  DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1 AUTO_INCREMENT=4 ;</textarea>

            <h2>Node js Session Management using express-session</h2>
            <p>We will use <code>express-session</code> node js module to manage session into application.This is a Simple session middleware for Express application.You need to instantiate session module into <code>app.js</code> file like below,</p>

            <p>To store session data into variable, we simply use the request property <code>req.session</code>, which is store serialized data into JSON, You can store single object or nested objects.</p>

            <p>We again use <code>req.session</code> property to get session value from session object, below code used to get <code>userId</code> from session,</p>

            <h2>How to show message/notification using req-flash in node js application</h2>
            <p>We will use <code>req-flash</code> node module to manage flash message.You can use this module to send validation message or success message or any other notification message from controller method to view. You dont need any configuration into <code>app.js</code> file.</p>
            <h3>How to set message into node js application</h3>
            <p>We will create a message variable and assign notification text into it.</p>

/**
* Module dependencies.
*/
var express = require('express')
  , routes = require('./routes')
  , user = require('./routes/user')
  , http = require('http')
  , path = require('path');
//var methodOverride = require('method-override');
var app = express();
var mysql      = require('mysql');
var bodyParser=require("body-parser");
var connection = mysql.createConnection({
              host     : 'localhost',
              user     : 'root',
              password : '',
              database : 'test'
            });
 
connection.connect();
 
global.db = connection;
 
// all environments
app.set('port', process.env.PORT || 8080);
app.set('views', __dirname + '/views');
app.set('view engine', 'ejs');
app.use(bodyParser.urlencoded({ extended: false }));
app.use(bodyParser.json());
app.use(express.static(path.join(__dirname, 'public')));
 
//Middleware
app.listen(8080)</textarea>

            <p>as you can see, I am running node server on <code>8080</code> port, you can change as per your need.You can get more info about nodejs and mysql from my previous article.</p>
            <p>Now run <code>node app.js</code> from command line that will show blank line without any error that means your server is connected with mysql. You can check on browser using <code>http://localhost:8080</code> url.</p>
            <h2>Login and Registration page in Nodejs application</h2>
            <p>We will add login and registration page into this nodejs application, we will create <code>user.js</code> file for control all action of login and registration process. We will create ejs template file for sign-in and signup view into views folder.</p>
            <p><strong>Step 1:</strong> Create a new <code>routes/user.js</code> file and store into routes folder.<br> <strong>Step 2:</strong> Create a get routes to load HTML template file in <code>app.js</code> file.</p>

                        &lt;!--&lt;div style="float:right; font-size: 80%; position: relative; top:-10px"&gt;&lt;a href="#"&gt;Forgot password?&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;--&gt;

                    &lt;div style="padding-top:30px" class="panel-body" &gt;
                                                                        &lt;% if (message.length &gt; 0) { %&gt;
                                                                                    &lt;div class="alert alert-danger col-sm-12"&gt;&lt;%= message %&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
                                                                        &lt;% } %&gt;
                           
                        &lt;form id="loginform" class="form-horizontal" role="form" method="post" action="/login"&gt;
                                   
                            &lt;div style="margin-bottom: 25px" class="input-group"&gt;
                                        &lt;span class="input-group-addon"&gt;&lt;i class="glyphicon glyphicon-user"&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/span&gt;
                                        &lt;input id="login-username" type="text" class="form-control" name="user_name" value="" placeholder="username"&gt;                                       
                                    &lt;/div&gt;
                               
                            &lt;div style="margin-bottom: 25px" class="input-group"&gt;
                                        &lt;span class="input-group-addon"&gt;&lt;i class="glyphicon glyphicon-lock"&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/span&gt;
                                        &lt;input id="login-password" type="password" class="form-control" name="password" placeholder="password"&gt;
                                    &lt;/div&gt;
                                   
 
                               
                            &lt;div class="input-group"&gt;
                                      &lt;!--&lt;div class="checkbox"&gt;
                                        &lt;label&gt;
                                          &lt;input id="login-remember" type="checkbox" name="remember" value="1"&gt; Remember me
                                        &lt;/label&gt;
                                      &lt;/div&gt;--&gt;
                                    &lt;/div&gt;
 
 
                                &lt;div style="margin-top:10px" class="form-group"&gt;
                                    &lt;!-- Button --&gt;
 
                                    &lt;div class="col-sm-12 controls"&gt;
                                      &lt;button id="btn-login" type="submit" class="btn btn-success"&gt;Login  &lt;/button&gt;
                                     
 
                                    &lt;/div&gt;
                                &lt;/div&gt;
 
 
                                &lt;div class="form-group"&gt;
                                    &lt;div class="col-md-12 control"&gt;
                                        &lt;div style="border-top: 1px solid#888; padding-top:15px; font-size:85%" &gt;
                                            Don't have an account!
                                        &lt;a href="/signup"&gt;
                                            Sign Up Here
                                        &lt;/a&gt;
                                        &lt;/div&gt;
                                    &lt;/div&gt;
                                &lt;/div&gt;   
                            &lt;/form&gt;    
 
 
 
                        &lt;/div&gt;                    
                    &lt;/div&gt; 
        &lt;/div&gt;
       
    &lt;/div&gt;
&lt;/body&gt;
&lt;/html&gt;</textarea>

&lt;html lang="en"&gt;
&lt;head&gt;
    &lt;meta charset="UTF-8"&gt;
    &lt;title&gt;Sample Site&lt;/title&gt;
    &lt;link rel="stylesheet" href="//maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/3.3.1/css/bootstrap.min.css"/&gt;
   &lt;script src="https://code.jquery.com/jquery-2.2.0.min.js"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;
    
&lt;/head&gt;
&lt;body&gt;
    &lt;div class="container col-sm-12" id="mainform"&gt;
            &lt;div id="signupbox" style=" margin-top:50px" class="mainbox col-md-6 col-md-offset-3 col-sm-8 col-sm-offset-2"&gt;
                                                           
                    &lt;div class="panel panel-info"&gt;
                        &lt;div class="panel-heading"&gt;
                            &lt;div class="panel-title"&gt;Sign Up&lt;/div&gt;
                            &lt;div style="float:right; font-size: 85%; position: relative; top:-10px"&gt;&lt;a id="signinlink" href="/"&gt;Sign In&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
                        &lt;/div&gt; 
                        &lt;div class="panel-body" &gt;
                            &lt;form class="form-horizontal" role="form" method="post" action="/signup" onSubmit="return checkblank(this);"&gt;
                                &lt;% if (message.length &gt; 0) { %&gt;
                                                                                                            &lt;div class="alert alert-success col-sm-12"&gt;&lt;%= message %&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
                                                                                                &lt;% } %&gt;
                                &lt;div id="signupalert" style="display:none" class="alert alert-danger"&gt;
                                    &lt;p&gt;Error:&lt;/p&gt;
                                    &lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;
                                &lt;/div&gt;
                                    
                                &lt;div class="form-group"&gt;
                                    &lt;label for="first_name" class="col-md-3 control-label"&gt;First Name&lt;/label&gt;
                                    &lt;div class="col-md-9"&gt;
                                        &lt;input type="text" class="form-control" name="first_name" placeholder="First Name"&gt;
                                    &lt;/div&gt;
                                &lt;/div&gt;
                                &lt;div class="form-group"&gt;
                                    &lt;label for="last_name" class="col-md-3 control-label"&gt;Last Name&lt;/label&gt;
                                    &lt;div class="col-md-9"&gt;
                                        &lt;input type="text" class="form-control" name="last_name" placeholder="Last Name"&gt;
                                    &lt;/div&gt;
                                &lt;/div&gt;
                                                                                                &lt;div class="form-group"&gt;
                                    &lt;label for="mob_no" class="col-md-3 control-label"&gt;Mobile Number&lt;/label&gt;
                                    &lt;div class="col-md-9"&gt;
                                        &lt;input type="number" class="form-control" name="mob_no" placeholder="Mobile Number"&gt;
                                    &lt;/div&gt;
                                &lt;/div&gt;
                                                                                                &lt;div class="form-group"&gt;
                                    &lt;label for="user_name" class="col-md-3 control-label"&gt;User Name&lt;/label&gt;
                                    &lt;div class="col-md-9"&gt;
                                        &lt;input type="text" class="form-control" name="user_name" placeholder="User Name"&gt;
                                    &lt;/div&gt;
                                &lt;/div&gt;
                                &lt;div class="form-group"&gt;
                                    &lt;label for="password" class="col-md-3 control-label"&gt;Password&lt;/label&gt;
                                    &lt;div class="col-md-9"&gt;
                                        &lt;input type="password" class="form-control" name="password" placeholder="Password"&gt;
                                    &lt;/div&gt;
                                &lt;/div&gt;
 
                                &lt;div class="form-group"&gt;
                                    &lt;!-- Button --&gt;                                       
                                    &lt;div class="col-md-offset-3 col-md-9"&gt;
                                        &lt;button id="btn-signup" type="submit" class="btn btn-info"&gt;&lt;i class="icon-hand-right"&gt;&lt;/i&gt; &amp;nbsp Sign Up&lt;/button&gt;
                                        
                                    &lt;/div&gt;
                                &lt;/div&gt;
                               
                                
                                
                                
                            &lt;/form&gt;
                         &lt;/div&gt;
                    &lt;/div&gt;
              
                
         &lt;/div&gt;
    &lt;/div&gt;
   
&lt;/body&gt;
&lt;/html&gt;</textarea>

            <p>Above steps will create login and signup page for users, so when you will open <code>http://localhost:8080</code> into browser, you will get sign-in and signup page.</p>
            <h3>Authenticate User using NodeJS and MySQL</h3>
            <p><img src="https://www.js-tutorials.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/login.png" alt="login" width="651" height="366" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-806" srcset="https://www.js-tutorials.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/login.png 651w, https://www.js-tutorials.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/login-300x169.png 300w" sizes="(max-width: 651px) 100vw, 651px"></p>
            <p>We will create user authentication using mysql and express JS. We will take input <em>username</em> and <em>password</em> from end user and post data to node server using POST HTTP method, now we will match username and password from MySQL table using SQL query.</p>
            <p>If the user match then we will redirect user to dashboard page otherwise send to login page with error message.I am using flash message module for validation message and session module for maintain session across nodej s application.</p>
            <p>we will create post request to authenticate user using MySQL. We will follow following steps to validate user,</p>
            <p><strong>Step 1:</strong> Create a new POST HTTP type routes in <code>app.js</code> file.</p>

exports.login = function(req, res){
   var message = '';
   var sess = req.session; 

   if(req.method == "POST"){
      var post  = req.body;
      var name= post.user_name;
      var pass= post.password;
     
      var sql="SELECT id, first_name, last_name, user_name FROM `users` WHERE `user_name`='"+name+"' and password = '"+pass+"'";                           
      db.query(sql, function(err, results){      
         if(results.length){
            req.session.userId = results[0].id;
            req.session.user = results[0];
            console.log(results[0].id);
            res.redirect('/home/dashboard');
         }
         else{
            message = 'Wrong Credentials.';
            res.render('index.ejs',{message: message});
         }
                 
      });
   } else {
      res.render('index.ejs',{message: message});
   }         
};</textarea>

            <p>as you can see, I have used session to store user information into session and message module for notification.</p>
            <h3>How to Register User in NodeJS Application</h3>
            <p><img src="https://www.js-tutorials.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/register.png" alt="register" width="700" height="420" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-808" srcset="https://www.js-tutorials.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/register.png 700w, https://www.js-tutorials.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/register-300x180.png 300w" sizes="(max-width: 700px) 100vw, 700px"></p>
            <p>Registration is very common process of any web application which has user management system.This step help to register user and store data into MySQL database.We have already created register template view file and now create an action method to post form data using express js.</p>
            <p>we will create post request to register user using MySQL. We will follow following steps to validate user,</p>
            <p><strong>Step 1:</strong> Create a new POST HTTP type routes in <code>app.js</code> file.</p>

             <div class="crayon-plain-wrap">
              <textarea wrap="soft" class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly style="-moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
exports.signup = function(req, res){
   message = '';
   if(req.method == "POST"){
      var post  = req.body;
      var name= post.user_name;
      var pass= post.password;
      var fname= post.first_name;
      var lname= post.last_name;
      var mob= post.mob_no;

      var sql = "INSERT INTO `users`(`first_name`,`last_name`,`mob_no`,`user_name`, `password`) VALUES ('" + fname + "','" + lname + "','" + mob + "','" + name + "','" + pass + "')";

      var query = db.query(sql, function(err, result) {

         message = "Succesfully! Your account has been created.";
         res.render('signup.ejs',{message: message});
      });

   } else {
      res.render('signup');
   }

            <h2>Create Dashboard page in nodejs application</h2>
            <p><img src="https://www.js-tutorials.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/dashboard.png" alt="dashboard" width="736" height="410" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-809" srcset="https://www.js-tutorials.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/dashboard.png 736w, https://www.js-tutorials.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/dashboard-300x167.png 300w" sizes="(max-width: 736px) 100vw, 736px"></p>
            <p>We need to create dashboard page into this node js example.We have created login functionality so when user will authenticate, we will redirect to dashboard home page.<br> create routes into <code>app.js</code> file.</p>
            <p><code>app.get('/home/dashboard', user.dashboard);//call for dashboard page after login</code></p>
            <p>We have created routes and assigned dashboard method with this url, now define dashboard action method into <code>user.js</code> file.</p>

	var user =  req.session.user,
	userId = req.session.userId;
	
	if(userId == null){
		res.redirect("/home/login");
		return;
	}
	 
	 var sql="SELECT * FROM `login_details` WHERE `id`='"+userId+"'";
	 
	   db.query(sql, function(err, results){
		   
		   console.log(results);
		   
		   res.render('profile.ejs', {user:user});	  
		  
		});	 
};</textarea>
